# The `ExistsOpInit` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

!exists&lt;type&gt;(expr) - Dynamically determine if a record of <code>type</code> named <code>expr</code> exists. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

### resolveReferences() {#ab6de6067eaae37cd7123806c0ed0d086}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const Init &#42; ExistsOpInit::resolveReferences (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/resolver">Resolver</a> &amp; R) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This function is used by classes that refer to other variables which may not be defined at the time the expression is formed.

If a value is set for the variable later, this method will be called on users of the value to allow the value to propagate out.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h/#l01187">1187</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h">Record.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp/#l02185">2185</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp">Record.cpp</a>.
